{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[105 BC]] &ndash; [[Battle of Arausio]]: The [[Cimbri]] inflict the heaviest defeat on the [[Roman Republic|Roman]] army of [[Gnaeus Mallius Maximus]].
*[[69 BC]] &ndash; [[Battle of Tigranocerta]]: Forces of the [[Roman Republic]] led by [[Lucullus]] defeat the army of the [[Kingdom of Armenia (antiquity)|Kingdom of Armenia]] led by King [[Tigranes the Great]].
*  [[23]] &ndash; Rebels kill and decapitate the [[Xin Dynasty]] emperor [[Wang Mang]] two days after the capital [[Chang'an]] is sacked during a [[Lülin|peasant rebellion]].
* [[404]] &ndash; Byzantine Empress [[Aelia Eudoxia|Eudoxia]] has her seventh and last pregnancy which ends in a miscarriage. She is left [[bleeding]] and dies of an infection shortly after.
*[[1539]] &ndash; Spanish conquistador [[Hernando de Soto]] and his army enter the [[Apalachee]] capital of [[Anhaica]] (present-day [[Tallahassee, Florida]]) by force.
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]], this day is skipped in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.
*[[1600]] &ndash; [[Jacopo Peri]]'s ''[[Euridice (opera)|Euridice]]'', the earliest surviving [[opera]], receives its première performance in [[Florence]], signifying the beginning of the [[Baroque Period]]
*[[1683]] &ndash; [[German American|German]] immigrant families found [[Germantown, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|Germantown]] in the [[Province of Pennsylvania|colony of Pennsylvania]], marking the first major immigration of German people to America.
*[[1723]] &ndash; [[Benjamin Franklin]] [http://www.ushistory.org/franklin/essays/franklinarrives.htm arrives] in [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], at the age of 17.
*[[1762]] &ndash; [[Seven Years' War]]: conclusion of the [[Battle of Manila (1762)|Battle of Manila]] between Britain and Spain, which resulted in the British occupation of [[Manila]] for the rest of the war.
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: General [[Henry Clinton (American War of Independence)|Sir Henry Clinton]] leads British forces in the capture of [[Continental Army]] [[Hudson River]] defenses in the [[Battle of Forts Clinton and Montgomery]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: [[Louis XVI of France|Louis XVI]] returns to Paris from [[Palace of Versailles|Versailles]] after being confronted by the Parisian women on [[5 October]]
*[[1849]] &ndash; The execution of the [[13 Martyrs of Arad]] after the Hungarian war of independence.
*[[1854]] &ndash; England: The [[Great fire of Newcastle and Gateshead]] starts shortly after midnight, leading to 53 deaths and hundreds injured.
*[[1876]] &ndash; The [[American Library Association]] was founded.
*[[1884]] &ndash; The [[Naval War College]] of the [[United States Navy]] is founded in [[Newport, Rhode Island]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; American inventor [[Thomas Edison]] shows his first [[film|motion picture]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; The [[High Court of Australia]] sits for the first time.
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Austria-Hungary]] annexes [[Bosnia and Herzegovina in Austria-Hungary|Bosnia-Herzegovina]], sparking [[Bosnian crisis|a crisis]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Eleftherios Venizelos]] is elected [[Prime Minister of Greece]] for the first time (7 times in total).
*[[1923]] &ndash; The great powers of [[World War I]] withdraw from [[Istanbul]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; Opening of ''[[The Jazz Singer]]'', the first prominent talking movie.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Germany's [[invasion of Poland]] ends with the surrender of [[Independent Operational Group Polesie|Polesia army]] after the [[Battle of Kock (1939)|Battle of Kock]]
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The October [[Actions along the Matanikau (September – October 1942)|Matanikau action]] on [[Guadalcanal]] begins as [[United States Marine Corps]] forces attack [[Imperial Japanese Army]] units along the [[Matanikau River]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Baseball]]: [[Billy Sianis]] and his pet billy goat are ejected from [[Wrigley Field]] during Game 4 of the [[1945 World Series]] (see [[Curse of the Billy Goat]]).
*[[1973]] &ndash; Egypt launches a coordinated attack with Syria against Israel leading to the [[Yom Kippur War]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Cubana Flight 455]] crashes into the Atlantic Ocean shortly after taking off from [[Bridgetown]], [[Barbados]], after two bombs, placed on board by [[Luis Posada Carriles#Cubana Flight 455, 1976|terrorists]] with connections to the [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]], exploded. All 73 people on board are killed.
*  1976   &ndash; New [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Premier]] [[Hua Guofeng]] orders the arrest of the [[Gang of Four (China)|Gang of Four]] and associates and ends the [[Cultural Revolution]] in the People's Republic of China.
*  1976   &ndash; [[6 October 1976 Massacre|Massacre of students]] gathering at [[Thammasat University]] in [[Bangkok]], [[Thailand]], to protest the return of ex-dictator [[Thanom Kittikachorn|Thanom]], by a coalition of right-wing paramilitary and government forces, triggering the return of the military to government.
*[[1977]] &ndash; In [[Alicante]], Spain, fascists attack a group of [[Communist Movement|MCPV]] militants and sympathizers, and one MCPV sympathizer is killed.
*  1977   &ndash; The first prototype of the [[MiG-29]], designated 9-01, makes its maiden flight.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] becomes the first pontiff to visit the [[White House]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; Egyptian President [[Anwar al-Sadat]] is assassinated.
*[[1985]] &ndash; PC [[Keith Blakelock]] is murdered as riots erupt in the [[Broadwater Farm]] suburb of London.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Fiji]] becomes a [[republic]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[51 Pegasi]] is discovered to be the second major star apart from the [[Sun]] to have a [[extrasolar planet|planet]] [[orbit]]ing around it.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Yugoslavia|Yugoslav]] president [[Slobodan Milošević]] resigns.
*  2000   &ndash; [[Argentina|Argentine]] vice president [[Carlos Álvarez (vice-president)|Carlos Álvarez]] resigns.
*[[2002]] &ndash; The French oil tanker ''[[Limburg (tanker)|Limburg]] ''is bombed off [[Yemen]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Jason Lewis (adventurer)|Jason Lewis]] completes the first human-powered circumnavigation of the globe.
